explanation:
code_hardening: Ensured getAcceptedIssuers returns a non-null empty X509Certificate array, marked TrustManager[] and HostnameVerifier locals as final, and added JavaDoc warning about test-only usage and security implications.
resolve_compilation_errors: Renamed the method to disableCertificateValidation, made it public and non-static to match its usage from setUp, and aligned the signature with the existing imports and calling context.
exception_handling: Removed internal try/catch blocks and declared throws GeneralSecurityException on the method signature so callers can handle or propagate initialization failures.
logic_customization: Switched SSLContext creation from "SSL" to "TLS" and preserved the behavior of installing an all-trusting TrustManager and HostnameVerifier on HttpsURLConnection.
refactoring: Renamed the method for clarity, added @Override annotations to implemented interface methods, and slightly restructured comments for readability without changing behavior.
misc: Added concise JavaDoc and minor formatting updates consistent with the surrounding test code; no new custom API calls were introduced.
